Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the event log provided, the activities that repeat within the same case are Verify Documents, Call Customer, and Adjust Account. Let me check each case to see how their meanings differ.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with Case C001: The first Verify Documents happens right after initiating the request, with the context that the agent checks identity docs. Then later, after the customer submits additional docs, theres another Verify Documents where the agent re-checks because the ID scan is now provided. So the second one is a re-verification after additional info.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then Call Customer in C001 occurs when the verification was incomplete and they needed missing docs. The context says Verification incomplete, agent calls to request missing docs. So thats a call to request missing documents. Then in C002, the first Call Customer is an outbound call to clarify an account discrepancy. The second call in C002 is a follow-up to confirm adjustments.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Adjust Account in C002 is after adjusting account details after a call. In C003, its an internal correction due to missing info. So maybe the first is Adjust Account Post-Discrepancy and the second is Adjust Account Due to Missing Info?

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me list all recurring activities across all cases: 1. Initiate Request: This is only once per case, so probably doesnt need renaming. Same with Approve Request. 2. Verify Documents occurs in all three cases. C001 has two, C003 has two. C002 only has one. Similarly, Call Customer occurs three times across cases. C002 has two calls. C003 has one.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So the plan is to rename the activities that repeat in the same case. For C001s two Verify Documents: First: Initial Document Verification Second: Re-Verify Documents Post-Additional Submission. For the Call Customer in C002: First: Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy Second: Follow-Up Confirmation Call.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For C003s two Verify Documents: First: Physical ID Verification Second: Re-Verify Documents Post-Account Adjustment.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now for the Adjust Account in C002 and C003. Since they are in different cases but only once each, maybe they dont need renaming unless their context in their own case is ambiguous. The problem says the same activity names appear multiple times within a single case so only those that are duplicated in the same case need renaming.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case C001 has two Verify Documents and one Call Customer. Case C002 has two Call Customer. Case C003 has two Verify Documents. Therefore, those are the ones that need renaming.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: In C001, the Call Customer occurs once, so no duplication here. In C003, the Call Customer is once. Adjust Account occurs once in each case, so no need to rename unless their context is ambiguous.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: For C001s first Verify Documents: Initial Document Verification since its the first check after initiation. Second: Re-Verify Documents After Additional Submission. For C002s calls: Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy and Follow-Up Confirmation Call. For C003: Physical ID Verification and Re-Verify Documents Post-Account Adjustment.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now, lets check the other activities. For example, in C003s Call Customer, the context is customer stepped out, so officer calls to have them return. Since its only once, perhaps leave as is.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - IND
Text: The problem says to rename only the activities that are duplicated in the same case. The other instances can stay as Call Customer unless their context is ambiguous in their own case.
